def isGood(x, y):
    modx = x % 2
    mody = y % 2
    if mody == 0 and (x <= 0 and modx == 0 or (x > 0 and modx == 1) or (x >= -abs(y) and x < abs(y - 1) + 1)):
        return 'YES'
    elif mody == 1 and (x > 0 and modx == 1 and (y >= 2 - x) and (y < x + 1) or (x < 0 and modx == 0 and (y >= x + 1) and (y < -x))):
        return 'YES'
    return 'NO'
t = int(input())
ret = ''
while t > 0:
    (x, y) = [int(i) for i in input().split()]
    ret += isGood(x, y) + '\n'
    t -= 1
print(ret[:-1])
